subject: Accidents and Safety
lead_paragraph: A van driven by the former Alabama star running back Siran Stacy was struck by a pickup truck at an intersection in Dothan, Ala., late Monday. Six people were killed, including Stacy’s wife and four of his children, the police said. The driver of the second vehicle was also killed. The police said the pickup was on the wrong side of the four-lane road when it struck Stacy’s van on the passenger side.Stacy, 39, the first pick of the Philadelphia Eagles in the 1992 draft, was listed in stable condition in surgical intensive care in Dothan. His 3-year-old daughter, Shelly, was taken to Children’s Hospital in Birmingham, which did not release her condition.The victims were identified as Stacy’s wife, Ellen Stacy, 36; their children, Lequisa, 18; Bronson, 10; Sidney, 8; and Ellie, 2; and the other driver, Adam W. Wayman, 29.
